summary: Richard N Billings is listed as an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations in several payroll and certification reports from 1978 and 1979. These documents detail the committee's staff, their positions, salaries, and pay period earnings. Billings appears consistently across multiple reports, indicating his ongoing employment with the committee during the specified periods. The documents do not specify his exact role within the committee, but his presence on the payroll suggests he was a staff member involved in the investigation of the JFK assassination.
significance: Richard N Billings' significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the committee's payroll suggests he contributed to the investigation in some capacity.
